r.s: Display-Off Timeout must be at least 5 seconds less than Display-Off Check Time

If the task lasts a long time (e.g. due to having a loop) this may drain your battery much more quickly than usual.
When enabled, relevant warning and error messages are flashed to the screen when they occur.\n\nNote: not all warnings/errors are flashed.

If you have a problem or question, see\n\n\tMenu / Info / Support

please assign an icon to the project
zoom not possible with Navigate mode

How long, if at all, to keep local backup copies of user data.

Auto-Backups are made everytime the Tasker UI is exited via the main screen.

You can restore a backup via Menu / Data / Restore / Auto Local Backup.

The backups are stored in

	/sdcard/Tasker/configs/auto/

Warning: the backups are not encrypted and sensitive data could be read by other apps.
The Run Log may store sensitive information contained in variables in a way accessible to 3rd Parties.\n\nIf there are concerns about this, the Run Log should be cleared after every use.
The Max Frequency you have configured is higher than the initial system maximum.\n\nThat probably means it's not a good idea to set it so high.
sorry, couldn't open Android Settings, please make the change manually
that variable probably won't work on this device or Android version
couldn't backup data to internal storage
Controls have been set to current time
Please enter the order number you received from Android Market
need data network available for maps
Long-click on the Tasker icon in the top-left corner of the screen to quickly enable or disable Tasker.\n\nThe icon is grey when Tasker is disabled.
Whether to limit the number of times the profile can become active e.g. if its enter task should only be run once.
the disclaimer has not been accepted
To import downloaded data, long-click on the relevant tab and select Import.
Whether to customize the system notification pulldown in order to fit more information and if so, with which text colour (select Black Text for a standard ROM).

Determines how close gestures need to be to the recorded pattern in order to match.

Too low values will cause gestures to be missed very often.

Too high values will causes gestures to be matched when they weren't intended.
a context with that name and type already exists
%1$s: variable %2$s doesn't hold a numeric value

The default theme has changed, if you don't like it several alternatives are available at Prefs / UI / Theme

Tasker now has 3 configurable Quick Settings tiles

On Android 7.1+, long-click the Tasker icon for app shortcuts

In a list, only selected items can be dragged. You can change back to the old dragging method via Prefs / UI / List Item Dragging)
%1$s: bad variable name: must start with %% and be 3 or more alphanumeric characters or _, not starting/ending in _
Permissions that the app needs on the device it's used on in order to function correctly.
changed %1$d action(s) referring to this profile
task contains action(s) unsuitable for import

If an Wifi Near state is defined, periodic Wifi scans are launched to check for an access point matching the specified characteristics. This setting specifies the number of seconds between such checks.

Small values will result in Tasker responding more quickly but will result in more battery usage.

While the device is asleep, the value of All Checks is used.

See Also: action Set Tasker Pref.
wallpaper must be a .png or .jpg image
The import is now accessible from my UI.\n\nLong-click on the relevant top-tab.

Tasker has loaded data specified by an external app which has Tasker's AUTO_IMPORT permission.

If you don't want to use that configuration, you should exit Tasker without saving.

If you don't want it to be possible in the future, you should remove the relevant app.

It's not possible to show an exit button with a non-blocking Overlay. Please deselect the Show Exit Button parameter. Important: you must arrange removal of the scene yourself via a Hide Scene or Destroy Scene action, otherwise it's possible to deny yourself access to the device by obscuring the whole display.

This is the Scene Editor.

It starts in 'Preview' mode, which shows exactly how the scene will look when it is eventually displayed.

In Preview Mode you can also resize the scene by dragging on the edges.

When you've finished resizing, click the Zoom (magnifying glass) icon in the bottom right.
please specify one of From, Repeat or To
Killing certain system applications can disrupt the functioning of your device.\n\nFor instance, killing the Alarm Clock application may prevent future alarms going off.
sorry, context tabs can't be customized

Whether to keep on the light sensor when the device display is off.

Affects the Light Level state and the %LIGHT variable.

Note that on some devices Android may turn off the sensor irrespective of the Tasker setting.
You can export a profile in a standalone app by putting it in a project and exporting the project.\n\nSee App Creation in the Userguide for more info.
failed to backup user tab data
This will overwrite the existing keystore.\n\nIf you have published apps using the old keystore, you will no longer be able to update them.

Time between starting the preview and taking the photo (to allow time to aim, focus).

Has no effect on Photo actions in which the Discrete flag is set.

See Also: action Set Tasker Pref.

It's strongly recommended you press Menu and read Location Without Tears before creating a location context.\n\nIn particular, note that GPS is very battery hungry and the alternatives are often better.
%1$s is not possible currently because a lock code has been set
sorry, can't drag to context tabs
Encryption actions are not available in the Play Store version of Tasker due to US export restrictions.
export failed due to missing plugin(s)
Sorry, that state is unavailable on this device

Software plugins that the app needs on the device it's used on in order to function correctly.

This action has been removed from Tasker, meaning it no longer does anything and should be deleted.

Often such action have been replaced by e.g. extra parameters in another action, please consult the release notes with

Menu / Info / Release Notes

from the main screen.
You will not be able to remove it if it's forgotten.\n\nContinue ?
The built-in GrazeRSS action in the 3rd Party category provides more functionality than using the plugin.

Click on the context (left) or task (right) to edit them.\n\nLong-click for options.
%1$s: you can't use local variables (all lower-case) here

In order to save space on the device, the Userguide in each language is not part of the application package.

You can view individual pages directly online, or download all of the pages at once to internal storage.

The documents can be also downloaded at any time via the Download button at Menu / Prefs / UI / Language

if they are not up-to-date.
Changing the CPU governance can result in hardware failure due to CPU overheating; please read the CPU Control section of the userguide.\n\nYou proceed at your own risk!
Ensure that tasks resulting from this profile activation or deactivation remain queued until previous tasks from this profile are complete.
This action requires root since Google prevents apps changing the Mobile Data status in Android 6.0+.\n\nA more flexible alternative is in any case the action Network Access in the Net category.

The Screen Brightness action will not work well when Auto-Brightness is enabled, which it currently is.

To disable Auto-Brightness, see the Brightess setting in the Android Sound and Display settings screen.

On some devices you can also use Tasker to change the Auto-Brightness setting.
You can re-enable tips by tapping the Tips checkbox.\n\n(snicker)

For Android 2.3+ Google have made changes such that it is no longer possible for a normal app to change GPS without user-interaction.\n\nIf you wish to continue using Tasker's GPS action you may wish to consider rooting your device and installing the Secure Settings plugin.
Clear all data, including profiles etc ?
Click on a colour-box to select the drawing colour. Long-click to change it.
Sorry, bad code, please try again

A scene displayed as an Overlay does not allow user-interaction.\n\nThe interactive elements in the scene you've specified will therefore be disabled.
Seek point past end of track
Long-click an item for more information.

Whether to keep on the step sensor when the device display is off.

Affects the Steps Taken state.

For low-power step counting while the device is off, select Yes. Events will then be triggered when the device wakes up.

For immediate triggering when the device is off, select the final entry.
requires Tasker's Notification Listener service and it's not running
sorry, that package name is invalid
This is a setting action, indicated by the tools icon right in the action list.\n\nIt means that when this profile is no longer active the value will be restored automatically.
please specify one or more actions for this task

The number of iterations of the algorithm to generate a cryptographic key from the entered passphrase. This operation takes place when a passphrase is entered. A higher number is more secure but takes longer to calculate.\n\n*Important*: if you change this you will no longer be able to decrypt files that were encrypted with the old number of iterations.

In the text field you can enter a direct image URI, optionally including use of Tasker variables.

The most common supported URI scheme is file.

Network-based schemes (e.g. http) are not supported.
a Class cannot be specified unless a Package is also specified

This option enables much reduced power usage while the device is stationary and faster response time in most situations.

However, in the following situations this option will cause problems:

* using state BT Near and the device to detect is mobile
* using Wifi or BT Near state when the BT device or Wifi AP is turned on or off
* using GPS location when the desired radius is less than a few tens of metres
This is an event tab corresponding to a way in which the user can interact with this element.\n\nHere you can configure a task that should run when the event takes place.

When enabled, the screen will be kept on (dimly) when performing checks for Cell Near and Net Location contexts.

This is to work around a bug in some Android versions where updates are not received while the screen is off.

This option uses extra power, don't enable unless necessary.
Shading a shape involves a start colour, an end colour and a shader.\n\nThe shader decides how the transition takes place from the start colour to the end colour as the shape is filled with colour.
The minimum version of Android needed to use the app.\n\nYou might want to change this if your app uses a function that's e.g. only available in Android 4.0+
Disabling this option will save memory, but the UI will be a fraction slower and some decorations will be missing.
Don't forget to enter a Lock Code in\n\nMenu / Prefs / UI / Lock Code
To apply changes then exit, you can also just press the Back or Home button in the main screen.
Wifi Scan must be at least
you must specify at least one context
that built-in variable is not valid here

If a Location Context is defined, periodic checks are carried out to see if that location has been entered/exited. This setting specifies the *minimum* number of seconds between checks of the GPS receiver while the device is awake.

Small values will result in Tasker responding more quickly when the location changes, but will result in more battery usage.

While the device is asleep, the value of All Checks is used.

See Also: action Set Tasker Pref.
Sorry, that action is unavailable on this device
couldn't save data, making emergency backup on internal storage

When no part of any gesture has been matched, the device position is checked less often to save power. This is the rate at which Tasker checks tries to match the first point of each gesture.

High values will cause the start of gestures to be missed often but save (some) power.

Low values will use more battery power but be less likely to miss a gesture.
zoom not possible with an Address

The package name uniquely identifies your new app to Android. The format is roughly that of a domain name e.g. your email address backwards with the @ replaced by . Example: fred.smith@a.domain.com would become com.domain.a.smith.fred.appname The package name should consist solely of . and lower-case character a to z. Numbers are also allowed, but no tuple may be purely numeric e.g. crazy.23.house is disallowed.

A profile has one or more 'contexts' that decide under what conditions it should be active i.e. do something.

For example, an Application context is active when you are using a particular application.

Choose the type of the first context for your new profile. You can add more later if needed by clicking on this first one.
the hour repeat value should be 1–12
The times after the profile has become active before it can again become active.\n\nCooldown time is reset after a reboot.
Bluetooth LE on Android is currently full of bugs and problems and so this feature should be considered experimental.\n\nIt will likely work best for unpaired (and always discoverable) devices.
app specification only functional in Android 6.0+

Whether to keep on the magnetic sensor when the device display is off.

Affects the Magnetic Field state and the %MFIELD variable.

Note that on some devices Android may turn off the sensor irrespective of the Tasker setting.
The icon shown in the status bar when Tasker's monitor service is running in the foreground.

This action requires Tasker's Device Administrator to be enabled.

Tasker only uses the administrator to lock the device, and only when you specify.

Would you like to enable it now ?
Failed to move import to my storage directory.

When a task is selected, it will be shown in the permanent monitor notification (by pulling down on the notification) and can be run directly from there.\n\nWhen no task is selected for the first button, a Disable button will be shown in the notification, if Tasker has not been locked with a passcode.
Net and/or GPS must be enabled

It looks like Tasker recently crashed.

If this happens frequently, it would be great if you could report it at the forum or via email, see:

	Menu / Info / Support

We'd love to help find the problem.

While Tasker's device administrator is active, Android will not allow you to uninstall Tasker.\n\nTo uninstall, you will need to first deactive the device administrator via Android Settings / Security / Device Administration (on most devices).
Each tab can have an individual sort.\n\nThe profiles can only be arranged by the user with a User sort.
On some Android versions, notification icons will always by shown by Android in a particular colour, usually white

When enabled, warning and error messages are saved to a file when they occur. The next time Tasker is launched, any which occurred since the last launch are displayed.\n\nThe maximum size of the log file is 2K.
please specify only one of '%1$s' or '%2$s'
sorry, that test type is unavailable on your device

The profile you've just created will be active in the morning and evening of the day(s) you have selected, *not* the evening of the selected day and the following morning.

Example:
	Time: 21:00-06:00 
	Day: Tuesday
Active: 00:00-06:00 and 09:00-11.59 on Tuesday only.
the gesture pattern has an incorrect format, please record it again
Select an existing file with a tap, or select a directory with a long-tap and then fill in a file name.
no Day Context is needed if all months or days are selected
The task that will be launched when the app icon is clicked in the launcher.\n\nAny data it was launched with will be available in the local variable %launch_data.

For file operations on external storage, Android requires that the user grant Tasker permission first.\n\nPlease select your external storage in the following dialog so that the action can be carried out automatically in the future.
the scene contains elements (Map or TextEdit) that cannot be used in an Overlay

Allows more precise specification of the element's position (x,y) and size (width x height) than is possible via finger adjustment.\n\nThere is a separate geometry specification for each display orientation (portrait and landscape).
your Android version doesn't seem to have the cropping feature
Tasker only uses the administrator to lock the device, and only when you specify via a System Lock action.
If checked, the lock code is requested as soon as the UI starts, if Tasker has been validated. It's also requested when creating a widget or shortcut.

When a gesture has been partially matched, if this number of milliseconds elapses without further progress on matching the gesture, Tasker assumes you were not actually trying to do this gesture.

Too low values will cause gesture matching too abort too often while you're still busy doing them.

Too high values will cause gestures to match which you didn't intend, purely from random movements of the device.
There are several on-device JavaScript code editors available, for example DroidEdit, 920 Text Editor and Touchqode.
please enter a variable name for the condition
a %1$s scene requires a %2$s element called '%3$s'
This probably won't work with a CDMA phone, if not try the 3rd Party / APN Droid action instead.

Turn off GPS fixing after this many seconds, if Android has not already done so.

Applied only when the screen is on.

Note: if you put this too low Tasker will very rarely or never get a fix.

See Also: action Set Tasker Pref.

On most modern devices this action will not function without problems and side-effects due to changes in Android.

If you experience device instability, try disabling it.

The Secure Settings plugin offers the same functionality and is more effective for some people.
Battery optimization can be disabled at any time via Menu / More / Android Settings
Tasker does not support Turn On on this device.\n\nYou could try the Wake Device action in the Secure Settings plugin.

By disabling the safeguard you make it possible to set your brightness to zero on some versions of Android, which makes the screen unusable.\n\nBe especially careful if setting the brightness from a variable value in that case.
You can press Menu then Info on most screens to access help.
the specified Resolution is not supported by the selected camera
When the + symbols are showing, you can long-click on an app to select a sub-activity within it.

Affects the Pressure state and the %PRESSURE variable.

Note that on some devices Android may turn off the sensor irrespective of the Tasker setting.

Move your finger around the circle till the desired colour is shown in the centre.

\n\nAfter selection, the value can be edited manually if desired e.g. to change the transparency.
Clear the value of the variable(s) ?

The algorithm to use for generating a key from the entered password (the first part) and for encrypting the data using the key (the second part).

In general, the items in the list are ordered with increasing security and decreasing speed.

*Important*: if you change this you will no longer be able to decrypt files that were encrypted with a different algorithm.
Hardware features that the app needs in the device it's used on in order to function correctly.\n\nMay be used by app publishers to restrict the users the app is offered to.
not numeric and not a variable

If a Location Context is defined, periodic checks are carried out to see if that location has been entered/exited. This setting specifies the *minimum* number of seconds between checks of non-GPS location providers while the device is awake.

Small values will result in Tasker responding more quickly when the location changes, but will result in more battery usage.

While the device is asleep, the value of All Checks is used.

See Also: action Set Tasker Pref.
An SD log may disclose sensitive information, please read the help text.

This is a 2nd Enter task which will be carried out immediately after the 1st one.\n\nThis profile does not have an Exit task because it is 'Instant'; it contains a context which is only active for an instant.

Affects how close to the specified orientation the device must be for an Orientation state context to become active.\n\nHigher sensitivity requires that the device be closer to the specified orientation.
please select at least one application
Display-Off Check Time must be at least

If an application context is defined, periodic checks are carried out to see if that particular application has launched. This setting specifies the number of milliseconds between such checks.

Small values will result in Tasker responding more quickly when an application launches, but will result in slightly more battery usage.

While the device is asleep, the value of All Checks is used.

See Also: action Set Tasker Pref.
Application Check must be at least 100ms

An app has been installed which wants to monitor Tasker auto-backups to external storage, so that feature has been enabled.\n\nNote that any backup of your Tasker configuration is readable by any app on the system.
sorry, that type of icon can't be used with shortcuts
BT Min Timeout must be at least 15 seconds less than Display-On BT Check Time

When enabled, other activities on the device can run existing tasks from your configuration when they like. They can also submit their own tasks to be run but in that case 'dangerous' actions are not allowed e.g. Send SMS, CPU, Call.
User-Variables are Tasker's 'glue'. They are used to store pieces of information and communicate between tasks.\n\nYou can set and clear variables either in tasks or directly via this tab.

Your task contains one or more variables which need to be monitored but are not currently being monitored, which means they do not have a value yet. If you want to go ahead anyway, click Test again. Tasker will automatically start monitoring if you reference the variable in a profile or task and click Apply from the profile list. You can find which variables are monitored on the Variables page of the userguide.
You should press the Preferences button to calibrate the accelerometer before using this feature.
points too close, maybe decrease match radius ?

How ofter to check whether a new Tasker version is available. The check is done when Tasker's UI is started, if the required time has elapsed since the last check.\nThe check requires Internet access.\nDoes not function until Tasker has been validated.

Select the type of the context to add to this profile.

\n\nWhen a profile has more than one context, *all* of them must be active before the profile will become active.
Tasker may not work well in many situations while it is being battery-optimized by Android.\n\nWould you like to disable that ?
the smallest minute repeat value is 2
Enables various debugging mechanisms in the new app (debuggable APK, system log, Tasker log, popups etc)

Tasker has recently crashed due to running out of memory.\n\nYou might wish to delete something from your device to make more space if this happens frequently.
plugin error: disabled or not exported activity, or disabled application

Turn off Wifi scanning after minimally this many seconds. Tasker will adjust the used timeout dynamically based on how quickly results arrive but not below this setting.

Note: if you put this too low you may start missing access points, too high and will waste power.

See Also: action Set Tasker Pref.

When enabled, debugging messages are sent to the system log e.g. when an action is executed or an event received.

The timespan of the logfile is usually less than 5 minutes when the device is in use.

Warning: you should be aware that sensitive data (e.g. calendar entry titles) may be logged so you should uncheck this option when you are finished logging.
.jpg suffix is unnecessary and has been removed
this action doesn't work with a %1$s element
On some Android versions, icons for notification actions are not displayed.
A newer version is available, please leave and restart Tasker
If you don't enter any values then any entry in your calendar will match.\n\nIf you want to e.g. match any calendar entry where you are busy then set Available to No.
The Run Log is not enabled.\n\nWould you like to enable it now ?
To perform this action, the additional %1$s %2$s must be installed.\n\nShould I try to install it now ?

If an application context needs to check for services, periodic checks are carried out to see if a relevant service is running. This setting specifies the number of milliseconds between such checks.

Small values will result in Tasker responding more quickly when a service launches, but will result in slightly more battery usage.

While the device is asleep, the value of All Checks is used.

See Also: action Set Tasker Pref.
Perhaps you are behind a proxy ?
This action may not work on some devices. If it doesn't, a root-only plugin is available, see Nougat Tasker Tethering Toggle in Play Store.
you still have %1$d action(s) referring to the old profile name
The password needs to be entered twice to check it's correct.
the From value must be less than, or equal to, the To value
Tasker is currently in Beginner Mode. You can make more options available (including variables and projects) by unchecking: Menu / Prefs / UI / Beginner Mode
Do you accept the disclaimer which was just shown ?
The profile binds together contexts and actions.
Whether to use internal storage when exporting an app to a project.\n\nThat may be slower, but may be desirable if RAM is limited.

From version 4.2, Android makes available a new method for detecting cell towers. This does not work well on all devices and Tasker therefore continues to use the old method by default.\n\nIf you enable this setting, be aware that the cell IDs it returns may be incompatible with those returned by the old API and so old Cell Near states may need to be rescanned and matching of the variable %CELL may need to be changed.
%1$s is not available in Android %2$s, try the Secure Settings plugin and a rooted device
Please first create a profile with event UI / Assistance Request.
%1$s: not that many actions in this task. Use Stop if you want to stop the task.
Whether this profile should be deleted when the repeat count gets to 0.
the task has overlapping non-nested blocks e.g. For, If, End For, End If or an unmatched End If / End For

Reliable alarms improve accurate timing of operations and may help prevent Tasker being killed by the system to save power etc.

Unfortunately they are also visible in the notification bar.

See Also: Android System Power Management in the userguide.
%1$s: out of memory building file list
A system log may disclose sensitive information, please read the help text.

To buy from Play Store:

* backup data via Menu / Data / Backup
* delete this trial version via Android Settings / Apps
* search for Tasker on Play Store.
You should use the action Script / Run SL4A Script instead of using the SL4A plugin.
Other permissions that you wish the app to have.

If Cell Near is not working while the device is off, it's probably due to an Android bug.

There are two workarounds available in Prefs / Monitor / Display Off Monitoring which may fix the problem.

For newer devices, consider also enabling Prefs / General / Use New Cell API.
please enter a value for the condition right-hand-side
If application contexts are not working for you, please see the FAQ:\n\nhttp://tasker.dinglisch.net/faq-problem.html#app
%1$s: you can only use local variables (all lower-case) here
a project with that name already exists
The sub-part of the Organisation e.g. a department name.

If you remove the exit button it's possible to accidentally deny yourself access to the device by obscuring the whole screen.\n\nPlease make sure you have put in place an alternative way to hide the scene.

Tasks are sequences of actions which you would like Tasker to perform.\n\nThey could be triggered by e.g. the conditions of a profile being met, clicking on a home-screen widget or by interacting with a scene.
please rotate your device at as many angles as possible
changed %1$d action(s) referring to the old task name
data integrity problems were found and repaired
Installing Text-To-Speech data, please try again afterwards...
sorry, the sync settings dialog is not available

See Prefs / Misc / Allow External Access
This application requires the %1$s %2$s, please install it.

When enabled, debugging messages are written to Tasker/log/tasker.txt on internal storage. It will use extra power and processor time, so don't enable it unless there's a specific problem you are looking for.

When the size is approximately 3MB the file will be truncated and earlier log messages lost.

The file is not always completely up-to-date because a buffer is used to improve writing efficiency. The buffer is flushed when Tasker is disabled.

Warning: sensitive data (e.g. calendar entry titles) may be logged so you should uncheck this option and delete the log file when you are finished.
You will no longer be able to update published apps signed via this keystore.
The priority at which the widget/shortcut task will be launched.
please specify exactly one of Address or Lat/Long

When enabled, Tasker will reduce resource usage relating to some functionality. This will usually also mean a reduction in performance in some way for those functions.\n\nSee Also: UI / Hardware Acceleration
It's recommended that you set a Custom Notification Layout with a transparent icon because otherwise the pulldown notification list will also not have an icon (which looks odd).
please set a Wait time of at least one second

Whether to permanently show Tasker's icon in the notification bar when it is enabled.

Enabling causes Tasker's notification to appear even if Run In Foreground is disabled.

May also affect visibility of Tasker's notification on the lock screen.
please select one or more months or days
Configure the tiles belonging to Tasker in the Android Quick Settings pulldown panel.\n\nSee Also: action Setup App Shortcuts.
Please wait at least %1$d seconds before again attempting to unlock Tasker.
What to do when another copy of this task is already executing.\n\nSee the page on Tasks in the Userguide for more information.

Whether to run Tasker's monitor service in the 'Foreground' or not.

When it runs in the foreground, it's unlikely to be destroyed by Android when resources on the device are low, and so likely to be more reliable.

When the monitor is running in the foreground, Android demands that it place a notification in the status bar. If the notification is annoying, you can disable this setting to remove the notification and see if the monitor service remains reliable.

If you are running on an Android device prior to 2.0, it's best to leave this option checked.
Usually a village, town or city.

Enabling phone access allows the referenced web content to run JavaScript, access data on your device and use Tasker functions to control your device.\n\nThat's a very bad idea if you didn't create the content yourself and it's not from a totally trusted source.
Profiles link contexts (conditions) with the tasks that should run when the conditions are met.
Can't enable Beginner Mode with projects defined

Whether to keep on the temperature sensor when the device display is off.

Affects the Temperature state and the %TEMP variable.

Note that on some devices Android may turn off the sensor irrespective of the Tasker setting.
Changes have been applied.\n\nYou don't need to do this before exiting Tasker, it's for making changes then continuing to edit.
If you install any appropriate plugins on your device then they will be listed in this category.

This event has been removed from Tasker, meaning it no longer does anything and should be deleted.

Often such events have been replaced by e.g. a new State context, please consult the release notes with

Menu / Info / Release Notes

from the main screen.
Long-press Call, Camera, Menu, Search or Volume Button to start recording points, single-press in-between, long-press on last point.

Click-and-drag in the centre of the element to move it.

Click-and-drag at the edge to resize it.

Long-click it for options, including deletion.

Press the Hand icon for easier moving/resizing.
Long-click on the tabs to configure them or add another.\n\nClick-and-drag the right side of list items to move them between tabs.
Min must be smaller than Max

Relevant only to the Cell Near state.

Enables a workaround for a bug in some Android versions where updates are not received while the screen is off.

As an unwanted side effect, this option will query GPS for a few seconds if that is enabled, using extra power.
not available when Tasker is locked
settings cannot be changed by a profile with an Event context
requires Tasker's Accessibility service and it's not running
File Magic must be installed for the Browse Files action
%1$s: can only be a single item of an array

Whether to keep on the humidity sensor when the device display is off.

Affects the Humidity state and the %HUMIDITY variable.

Note that on some devices Android may turn off the sensor irrespective of the Tasker setting.

This is an Enter task and will be carried out when the profile becomes active.

\n\nProfiles can in general only have one Enter task.

the launcher icon you've selected for the new app is disallowed
sorry, shredding is not possible as root
The priority of the enter and exit tasks run by this profile.\n\nNote: this does *not* affect the profile becoming active in any way.
Cleared variables continue to be shown as long as they are mentioned by a profile, task or scene.
please select an icon for the task
You can create your own standalone apps from tasks or projects.\n\nJust long-click it and select Export / As App.

Move mode is designed to make repositioning easier.

Tap an element and then use the arrows to move it, or just drag it as in Normal mode.

You can return to Normal mode with the Back key.
The Task priority of Tasks launched from a widget/shortcut press or task selection in a popup.\n\nSee the page on scheduling in the Tasks page of the Userguide for more information about priority.

no relevant elements found in scene '%1$s'
Backups older than the specified age will be erased when you leave Preferences.

The maximum number of seconds the device will take to perform any necessary checks while the screen is off.

Increasing this can severely affect your battery life, especially with a short All Checks time.

Decreasing it too much will mean you will e.g. rarely or never get a GPS fix in bad conditions.

See Also: action Set Tasker Pref.
Long-click on items to get options for them.
For customers who purchased a direct-download key on or before 23rd March, 2013:.
system calendar failure, deletion and resync recommended

The version of Android that this app is targeted at.\n\nThe target version affects the compatibility mechanisms which Android applies and may result in functionality being available which would otherwise not be.
All contexts in the profile must be active for the profile to be active.
Changing the UI language does not take full effect until Tasker is restarted.
You should use the action 3rd Party / APN Droid instead of using the APNDroid plugin.

This feature requires Tasker's accessibility service to be enabled. Would you like to enable it now ?
Whether to automatically restore the values of any settings (actions marked with a cog symbol) changed by this profile when it deactivates.\n\nSee also: Settings in the Userguide.
file permission needed to access %1$s, please select the storage area
sorry, projects containing the %1$s action can't be exported as apps
Data backup to internal storage completed

Configure the tiles belonging to Tasker in the Android Quick Settings pulldown panel.

Changes will only be visible once the tile has been manually added to the set of used tiles via the Android UI.

To close the Quick Settings panel after the tile is clicked, use either the Close System Dialogs or Status Bar action as the first action of the linked task.

See Also: action Setup Quick Setting.
data has object(s) with higher version than me (%1$d), please update Tasker
You can only detect notification clicks by applications other than Tasker if you enable Tasker's Accessibility Service.\n\nWould you like to enable it now ?
Wifi Min Timeout must be at least 15 seconds less than Display-On Wifi Check Time

Whether to keep on the proximity sensor when the device display is off.

Affects only the Proximity state.

Note that on some devices Android may turn off the sensor irrespective of the Tasker setting.
From Android 6.0, location services need to be enabled for Wifi Near to work. Battery saving location mode is sufficient.\n\nWould you like to enable location services now ?
GPS may take more than half an hour to get a fix when network unavailable
All of these actions require the relevant 3rd Party application to be installed.

settings are invalid (0 repeat count and Delete)
In the text field you can enter a direct mathematical expression, optionally including Tasker variables.
Display-On GPS Timeout must be less than Display-On GPS Check Time
Any backup of your Tasker configuration is readable by any app on the system.\n\nIf you have privacy concerns you should not enable this option.
You can put anything you like here e.g. 'v1.0' or 'Diamond Extreme'
The organisation which the certificate owner represents e.g. an educational establishment or employer.
Add menu items with the + icon.\n\nReposition or delete items by touch-and-dragging at their right-hand side.

If a BT Near state is defined, periodic bluetooth scans are launched to check for a device matching the specified characteristics. This setting specifies the number of seconds between such checks.

Small values will result in Tasker responding more quickly but will result in more battery usage.

While the device is asleep, the value of All Checks is used.

See Also: action Set Tasker Pref.
In many countries recording individuals' speech without their consent is illegal.

The maximum number of tasks that can be waiting to execute at once. New tasks will be ignored when this value is reached.\n\nIt's best to keep this value as low as possible so you get an early warning when you have an erronous task e.g. one with an infinite loop.
Click + to define a new Variable.
This application requires the %1$s %2$s.\n\nShould I try to retrieve it now ?

* Tasker's accessibility service must be enabled for app detection to work.

You can enable it via Android Settings / Accessibility, or by following the dialog which is shown after editing an app context in Tasker.

* the Keyguard action can cause blackouts, if you experience device instability try disabling it.

Plugins related to the screen lock may have similar problems.

* action Silent Mode and variable %SILENT are now used purely for toggling vibration.

Use action Interrupt Mode and variable %INTERRUPT for the new interruption modes.
%1$s: must be a variable or array name

* stringent battery optimization by Android may affect Tasker's reliability when the device is not charging, not moving and the display is off, see Android System Power Management in the Userguide

* for state Wifi Near to work, early versions of Android 6 require Location to be enabled in Android settings

* action Interrupt Mode is now called Do Not Disturb
an Address cannot be used with StreetView mode
This is Zoom mode, where you can add elements to your scene and configure them.
BT Scan must be at least %1$d

Android offers a cloud backup facility to enable backup and restore data across devices with the same Google account.

Only the previous version of the application data can be restored.

Requires global backups to be enabled in Android settings.

Warning: data may be unprotected during transport to and from the cloud.
Click where you would like to drag the selected items to.
This feature requires Tasker's notification access service to be enabled. Would you like to enable it now ?

Turn off BT scanning after minimally this many seconds. Tasker will adjust the used timeout dynamically based on how quickly results arrive but not below this setting.

Note: if you put this too low you may start missing access points, too high and will waste power.

See Also: action Set Tasker Pref.
please select a task or cancel
%1$d profile(s) reference the task(s), can't delete
should be comma-separated list of numbers indicating milliseconds
You need to re-enter Tasker before this change will take effect.
Locks the colour of built-in icons to match the UI theme. When visible outside of the UI, the selected colour will be used instead.
Any local export of your Tasker configuration is readable by any app on the system.\n\nContinue ?

the task has one or more Else actions with no corresponding If

You have specified a variable name which is all lower-case, meaning it is visible only in the task this action is part of.

In general, that's a good idea, but if you want it to be visible to other tasks or contexts you should make at least one letter upper-case.

Please see the Variables section of the Userguide for more info.
calendar name doesn't match any calendars:
Failed to unzip file %1$s, bad archive ?
dir %1$s doesn't exist and I couldn't make it

If a code is entered here, it must be entered again in the following situations:

 * delete a locked profile
 * viewing a locked profile
 * disabling Tasker
 * clear or restore profile data
 * view Tasker preferences
 * going to Task Edit screen (if any locked profiles have named tasks)
 * creating a Widget or Shortcut ((if any locked profiles have named tasks)

A profile can be locked via Profile Properties.

A locked, named profile will be automatically collapsed when the Tasker UI starts.

The code needs only to be entered once each time Tasker's UI runs.

Android reports that memory on your system is low, which can affect the reliable running of Tasker.

You could try:

* a reboot

* removing one or more applications

You can get an idea how much memory is available from

Android Settings / Applications / Running Services

(the memory bar at the bottom)
you can only export named profiles.\n\nYou can name a profile by long-clicking its header
Tasker does not support Torch on this device.\n\nYou should consider using the 3rd Party action and app TeslaLED which supports a much wider range of devices.
The aggressiveness with which Tasker auto-collapses profiles in the Profile List screen, from never to always.\n\nException: locked profiles are always collapsed when the UI starts up.
As you add more configurations, you probably want to organize them into Projects. See Menu / Info / Help: This Screen for more info. Access projects by long-clicking the + icon.

Resize mode is designed to make resizing easier.

Tap an element and use the arrows to resize it, or you can just click-and-drag the edges as in Normal mode.

You can return to Normal mode with the Back key.
your version of %1$s is too low, please update
a profile can contain a maximum of 3 contexts

This action is for expert users.

It is not suitable for sending images.

The maximum Data length is 133 bytes.

The value used for Application Check, BT Scan, Wifi Scan, GPS Check and Network Location Check when the device is turned off.

All checks are done simultaneously to conserve battery.

Note: if only an Application Check would be needed then no check is done while the device is off, to save battery.

See Also: action Set Tasker Pref.

Whether to keep on the accelerometer when the device display is off.

Affects the Gesture event, the Shake event and the Orientation state.

Note that on some devices Android may turn off the accelerometer irrespective of the Tasker setting.
screen timeout must be at least 7 seconds

Events are instantaneous, so any settings made via a profile containing an event context will not be restored.

For the same reason, such a profile also cannot have an Exit task.

See the Userguide for details.

Whether to keep the device running while the task is running. The default is that tasks will be guaranteed to be kept running for around a minute from their start time.\n\nBe careful specifying this option for a task with a loop, it can very quickly drain your battery.
the '%3$s' element in a %1$s scene must be a %2$s
